animateLipids.description.value: Whether the phospholipids forming the cell membrane should be animated.

glucoseMetabolism.description.value: Glucose fades and is removed from the inside of the cell simulating conversion for cellular metabolism.

audio.sounds.stereoCrossingSounds.descri.value: Emphasize solute transport direction by mapping sound to right (outside to inside) and left (inside to outside) channels.

screenButtonsHelpText.value: Explore what solutes can diffuse freely in a cellular environment.
Explore conditions to facilitate diffusion for solutes using transport proteins.
Explore conditions to actively transport solutes using transport proteins.
Play with all solutes and all transport proteins.

intro.value:
An observation window zooms in on a cross-section of a cell's membrane.
  The membrane consists of a wiggling phospholipid bilayer, a double-layered sheet
  that separates fluids inside and outside of cell. When added to outside or inside,
  solute particles are suspended in fluid and randomly move with Brownian motion.

proteins.value: Transport proteins of different types can be added directly to membrane.

potential.value: There are options to change cell environment and affect added proteins.

barCharts.value: Bar charts of solute concentrations dynamically compare solute amounts outside and inside cell.

controlArea.value: You can pause action or slow it down to hear more details, add or remove sounds and highlights that enhance solute crossings, and you can reset everything to start over.

leadingParagraph.value: Right now, zoomed-in cross section of cell has:

soluteTypesOnOutside.value:
{ $count ->
  [one] { $count } solute type on outside
 *[other] { $count } solute types on outside
}

soluteTypesOnInside.value:
{ $count ->
  [one] { $count } solute type on inside
 *[other] { $count } solute types on inside
}

transportProteins.value:
{ $proteinCount ->
  [one] { $proteinCount} transport protein
  *[other] { $proteinCount} transport proteins
} of { $proteinTypeCount ->
  [one] { $proteinTypeCount } type
 *[other] { $proteinTypeCount} types
}, in membrane

ligands.value: 2 added ligand types on outside only

atpReacting.value: ATP reacting to form ADP and phosphate, which regularly fade away on the inside

glucoseMetabolism.value: Glucose disappears from inside as it is metabolized by the cell

interactionHint.value: Add or remove solute to outside or inside of cell.

interactionHintWithTransportProteins.value: Add or remove solutes to outside or inside of cell, and play with transport proteins.

accessibleHelpText.value: Choose solute for adding or removing with Solute Adjusters.

accessibleContextResponse.value: Solutes cleared. Add solutes to observe changes

accessibleHelpText.value: Disabled when no solutes have been added.
Explore with or without visual highlights for solute crossings.

accessibleContextResponseChecked.value: Visual highlights for solute crossings, on.

accessibleContextResponseUnchecked.value: Visual highlights for solute crossings, off.

accessibleHelpText.value: Explore with or without unique sounds for solute crossings.
Add up to 7 proteins to membrane. Use keyboard shortcuts to grab, sort, and release proteins into membrane.
Transmembrane single channel proteins with open and closed states, and a triangle- or star-shaped ligand binding site. Grab to pull to membrane.
Transmembrane single channel proteins, always open. Grab to pull to membrane.
Transmembrane single channel proteins with open and closed states. Grab to pull to membrane.
Explore with or without charge signs showing membrane potential along inside and outside.

voicingHelpText.value: Explore with or without charge signs along membrane.

accessibleContextResponseCheckedNegative.value: Positive outside and negative inside; charge signs densely packed along membrane.
Positive outside and negative inside; charge signs lightly packed along membrane.

accessibleContextResponseCheckedPositive.value: Negative outside and positive inside; charge signs sparse along membrane.

accessibleHelpText.value:
Proteins that open to one side at a time and follow specific solute binding sequences to transport solutes across membrane.
  Sodium Potassium Pump, when open to inside has binding sites for 3 sodium and 1 phosphate. When open to outside has binding sites for 2 potassium.
  Sodium-Glucose Cotransporter, only open to outside and has binding sites for 2 sodium and 1 glucose. Requires specific solute concentrations to shuttle.
  Grab to pull to membrane.
Grab a ligand. When grabbed, use keyboard shortcuts to move ligand to binding site. Release to bind or let ligands bind naturally.

releasedOnBusyOrIncompatibleProteinRespo.value: Released. Binding unsuccessful. Ligand floats away.

movedAboveLigandGatedChannelResponse.value:
Above { $openOrClosed ->
[open]   open
*[closed] closed
} { a11y_transportProtein_briefName } { $ligandType ->
[triangleLigand] Triangle Site
*[starLigand]     Star Site
}, { $index } of { $transportProteinCount } Proteins.

movedAboveOtherChannelResponse.value:
Above { $openOrClosed ->
[open]   open
*[closed] closed
} { a11y_transportProtein_briefName }, { $index } of { $transportProteinCount } Proteins.

grabbedResponseWithHint.value: { a11y_ligandNode_grabbedResponse } Move ligand with A or D keys. Space to release.

grabbedResponseWithEmptyMembraneHint.value: { a11y_ligandNode_grabbedResponse } Space to release. Add transport proteins.

lowercaseName.value:
{ $soluteType ->
  [oxygen]        oxygen molecules
  [carbonDioxide] carbon dioxide molecules
  [sodiumIon]     sodium ions
  [potassiumIon]  potassium ions
  [glucose]       glucose molecules
 *[atp]           ATP molecules
}

uppercaseName.value:
{ $soluteType ->
  [oxygen]        Oxygen Molecules
  [carbonDioxide] Carbon Dioxide molecules
  [sodiumIon]     Sodium Ions
  [potassiumIon]  Potassium Ions
  [glucose]       Glucose Molecules
 *[atp]           ATP Molecules
}

briefName.value:
{ $soluteType ->
  [oxygen]        Oxygen
  [carbonDioxide] Carbon Dioxide
  [sodiumIon]     Sodium
  [potassiumIon]  Potassium
  [glucose]       Glucose
 *[atp]           ATP
}

amountComparison.value:
{ $amount ->
  *[none]  none
  [equal] amounts exactly equal outside and inside
  [allOutside] all outside, none inside
  [allInside] all inside, none outside
  [manyManyMoreOutside] many many more outside than inside
  [manyMoreOutside] many more outside than inside
  [aboutTwiceAsManyOutside] about twice as many outside as inside
  [aLotMoreOutside] a lot more outside than inside
  [someMoreOutside] some more outside than inside
  [littleBitMoreOutside] a little bit more outside than inside
  [roughlyEqualOutside] roughly equal amounts inside and outside
  [manyManyMoreInside] many many more inside than outside
  [manyMoreInside] many more inside than outside
  [aboutTwiceAsManyInside] about twice as many inside as outside
  [aLotMoreInside] a lot more inside than outside
  [someMoreInside] some more inside than outside
  [littleBitMoreInside] a little bit more inside than outside
  [roughlyEqualInside] roughly equal amounts inside and outside
}

averageCrossingDirection.value:
{ $direction ->
  [toOutside] crossings to outside
  [mostlyToOutside] crossings mostly to outside
  [inBothDirections] crossings in both directions
  [mostlyToInside] crossings mostly to inside
  [toInside] crossings to inside
  *[none] no recent crossings
}

accessibleHelpText.value: Adjust chosen solute amount on outside.
Adjust chosen solute amount on inside.

accessibleObjectResponse.value:
{ $amount ->
  [none] no
  [few] a few
  [some] some
  [smallAmount] small amount of
  [several] several
  [many] many
  [largeAmount] large amount of
  [hugeAmount] huge amount of
 *[maxAmount] max amount of
} { a11y_solutes_lowercaseName }

accessibleContextResponse.value:
{ $amountAdded ->
  [aLittle] A little
 *[aLot]    A lot
} { $addedOrRemoved ->
  [added]   added
 *[removed] removed
}. Now, { a11y_solutes_amountComparison }.

descriptionContent.value: A barchart for each solute captures amounts on either side of membrane, recent crossings captured with visual highlights and sounds. If needed, pause sim to freeze details for reading.

accessibleNameWithParticles.value:
{ a11y_solutes_uppercaseName }: { a11y_solutes_amountComparison }; { a11y_solutes_averageCrossingDirection }; { $outsideAmount ->
  [none] none
  [few] a few
  [some] some
  [smallAmount] small amount
  [several] several
  [many] many
  [largeAmount] large amount
  [hugeAmount] huge amount
 *[maxAmount] max amount
} outside, { $insideAmount ->
  [none] none
  [few] a few
  [some] some
  [smallAmount] small amount
  [several] several
  [many] many
  [largeAmount] large amount
  [hugeAmount] huge amount
 *[maxAmount] max amount
} inside.

glucoseMetabolism.value: Glucose disappears from inside as it is metabolized by the cell.

crossing.value:
{ $crossing ->
  *[none] no crossings
  [inside] crossings in
  [outside] crossings out
  [both] crossings in and out
}

inBalanceResponse.value: { a11y_solutes_uppercaseName } crossing steadily in both directions, now roughly equal.

manyTypesInBalanceResponse.value: Many solutes types crossing steadily in both directions.

accessibleHelpText.value: Add or remove triangle- and star-shaped ligands to outside of cell.

accessibleHelpTextNoSolutesProteinsHidde.value: Look for Solute Controls to add and remove solute types.

accessibleHelpTextWithSolutesProteinsHid.value: Observe crossing solutes. Look for Solute Controls to add and remove solute types.

accessibleHelpTextNoSolutesOrProteins.value: Membrane potential is { a11y_membranePotentialValue }. No proteins in membrane. Look for Transport Proteins and Solute Controls to add.

accessibleHelpTextWithSolutesNoProteins.value: Membrane potential is { a11y_membranePotentialValue }. No proteins in membrane. Observe crossing solutes. Look for transport proteins to add.

accessibleHelpTextWithProteinsNoSolutes.value:
Membrane potential is { a11y_membranePotentialValue }. Proteins in membrane, {$typeCount ->
[one] { $typeCount } type
*[other] { $typeCount } types
}. Look for Solute Controls to add or remove solutes types.

accessibleHelpTextWithSolutesAndProteins.value:
Membrane potential is { a11y_membranePotentialValue }. Proteins in membrane, {$typeCount ->
[one] { $typeCount } type
*[other] { $typeCount } types
}. Observe crossing solutes and protein changes, grab protein to re-order or delete.

accessibleObjectResponseOpenClose.value:
{ $state ->
   [openToInsideEmpty] open to inside
   [openToInsideSodiumBound] open to inside
   [openToInsideSodiumAndATPBound] open to inside
   [openToInsideSodiumAndPhosphateBound] open to inside
   [openToOutsideAwaitingPotassium] open to outside
   [openToOutsidePotassiumBound] open to outside

   [openToOutsideAwaitingParticles] open to outside 
   [openToOutsideAllParticlesBound] open to outside
   [openToInside] open to inside

   [closedNegative70mV] closed
   [openNegative50mV] open 
   [closed30mV] closed

   [closedNegative70mV] closed
   [closedNegative50mV] closed
   [open30mV] open

   [ligandBoundClosed] closed
   [ligandBoundOpen] open
   [ligandUnboundOpen] open
   [open] open 
   *[closed] closed                                           
}

accessibleContextResponse.value:
{ $state ->
   [openToInsideEmpty] Phosphate floats away, pumping 2 potassium to inside
   [openToInsideSodiumAndATPBound] ATP reacts, phosphate binds, pumping 3 sodium to outside

   *[openToInside] 2 sodium and 1 glucose shuttled to inside
}.

briefName.value:
{ $type ->
  [sodiumIonLeakageChannel]         Sodium-selective, Leakage
  [potassiumIonLeakageChannel]      Potassium-selective, Leakage
  [sodiumIonVoltageGatedChannel]    Sodium-selective, Voltage-Gated
  [potassiumIonVoltageGatedChannel] Potassium-selective, Voltage-Gated
  [sodiumIonLigandGatedChannel]     Sodium-selective, Ligand-Gated
  [potassiumIonLigandGatedChannel]  Potassium-selective, Ligand-Gated
  [sodiumPotassiumPump]             Sodium Potassium Pump
 *[sodiumGlucoseCotransporter]      Sodium-Glucose Cotransporter
}
